page.title: 09SW BASINGSTOKE: ECOLOGY
page.content: The southern parts of Basingstoke have seen a massive development in housing resulting in the loss of large areas of countryside. However, efforts have been made to integrate old{hedges with new housing and many new trees have been planted. Earth banks have been used alongside the M3 motorway in an attempt to remove{noise pollution. The M3 has acted as a natural barrier to the spread of housing and has helped conserve the countryside south of it.Stubble burning by local farmers sometimes annoys the local residents. With our{climate}and exposure to winds the chalky soil dries out very quickly. Nevertheless, rape seed and wild poppies have soon re-established themselves on the man-made banks. Skylarks and kestrels are plentiful and many house-martins,swifts,swallows and other house-loving{birds}visit us.
